structured_data.name: Données Air et Climat - Explorateur de données d'émissions
structured_data.method_of_access: Web interface query tool (Explorateur de données); downloadable data files in multiple formats
structured_data.description: Comprehensive greenhouse gas and atmospheric pollutant emissions inventory for France calculated by Citepa. The dataset includes annual inventory reports in multiple formats (Secten, CCNUCC for GHG; Secten, CEE-NU for atmospheric pollutants), monthly emissions barometer data, and emissions by commune. Data covers greenhouse gas emissions (expressed in tonnes of CO2 equivalent) and atmospheric pollutants (NOx, particulates, etc.). Updated annually with continuous improvement methodology. Includes interactive data explorer for accessing all emission data across different reporting formats and geometric perimeters.

structured_data.name: Les déchets ménagers et assimilés : plus de 600 kg collectés par habitant en 2021, le tri en hausse de plus de 20 % en 10 ans
structured_data.method_of_access: Downloadable files (PDF and Excel) available from INSEE website; data file (xlsx, 112 Ko) and printable version (pdf, 995 Ko) provided
structured_data.subsector: Solid Waste Disposal, Biological Treatment of Waste, Incineration and Open Burning
structured_data.description: INSEE Première publication (No. 2055, June 2025) analyzing household and similar waste collection in France (metropolitan France and La Réunion) for 2021. The dataset covers 41 million tonnes of waste collected by public waste management services, with 615 kg per capita. It includes analysis of waste sorting trends (up 21% over 10 years), waste composition by type (residual waste, recyclables, green waste, bulky items, construction debris), collection methods (door-to-door, separate collection, waste facilities), and treatment pathways (recycling, composting, incineration). Geographic variations by tourism zones, incentive pricing impact, and socioeconomic factors are analyzed. Data covers the period 2011-2021 with primary focus on 2021.
structured_data.granularity: National (France métropolitaine and La Réunion), with regional and intercommunal analysis

decision_log.summary: Plan for France with 60 structured queries.

decision_log.summary: Reviewed 3 documents from French official sources. The batch shows strong potential for waste sector GHGI data. CITEPA is France's official GHG inventory body with comprehensive emissions data including waste sector. INSEE provides detailed waste management statistics with downloadable datasets. The Cour des Comptes report on waste management is relevant but appears to be a policy/audit document rather than emissions data. All three sources are highly authoritative.
decision_log.reasoning: CITEPA is France's official greenhouse gas inventory body (Citepa calculates GHG and atmospheric pollutant emissions for France) and explicitly offers an interactive data explorer, annual reports in multiple formats (Secten, CCNUCC), and downloadable datasets covering all sectors including waste. INSEE provides recent (2021) waste management statistics with 41 million tonnes of data, per capita figures, and downloadable Excel files. Both sources are government-backed and contain structured data directly relevant to France's waste sector GHGI. The Cour des Comptes document, while authoritative, appears to be a policy audit rather than a primary data source.

decision_log.summary: Two highly credible French government sources have been identified with strong relevance to GHGI waste sector data. CITEPA is France's official greenhouse gas inventory body, and INSEE is the national statistical office. Both sources contain national-level emissions data and waste management statistics directly applicable to GHGI reporting requirements. The data covers the waste sector comprehensively with multiple reporting formats (CCNUCC, Secten) aligned with international GHG inventory standards.
decision_log.reasoning: Both sources meet ACCEPT criteria: (1) CITEPA is the official national GHGI body for France with data in internationally recognized formats (CCNUCC, Secten); (2) INSEE is the government statistical office providing authoritative waste management data; (3) Data covers key emission categories for the waste sector (landfill methane, waste treatment pathways); (4) National-level data is available and sufficient for GHGI purposes; (5) Both sources are credible, government-backed institutions with established methodologies. The search plan has successfully identified the primary authoritative sources for France's waste sector GHGI data. No deeper investigation is needed as the sources are clearly identified and accessible through web interfaces and downloadable files.
